alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 15 at 9:33AM EDT until September 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, long period nearshore breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet today. * For the Coastal Flood Advisory, long period nearshore swells of 5 to 9 feet during high tide tonight building to 12 to 18 feet during the Saturday afternoon high tide. Some splash-over expected near high tide tonight with widespread and possibly significant splash-over expected on Saturday. Beach erosion expected. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal York, Coastal Cumberland, Sagadahoc, Lincoln, Knox and Coastal Waldo Counties. In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM EDT this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from midnight tonight to 2 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions. Stay away from rock outcrops along the shoreline exposed to ocean waves, as waves can and easily sweep people into the cold ocean water. Some minor to moderate beach erosion expected with partial erosion of vulnerable dunes. Some minor coastal inundation expected. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
